data.message: Where do i go to give some suggestions to make Facebook more friendly for the blind?

replies.message: Hi Scott.. We're listening to all of the feedback we get from the Facebook community. If you have any suggestions, please let us know at: http://on.fb.me/1xSIrRP.  -Chantal

Hi Vatslav. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. The best way to report abusive content on Facebook is by using the Report link that appears near the content you would like to report. For some examples and to learn more, visit our Help Center at: http://on.fb.me/1vdx3CA -Chantal
And then the won't do anything about it or message you back even when they tell you to message them to resolve the problem. They will avoid you entirely.

@Facebook - There are tons of pages out there that violate the rules (just do a search for "Motherf****er" - but actually use the letters I left out). Yet real people who just want to be themselves and have had decent pages that harm no one have had pages reported for 'fake names', or 'offensive content' that some troll doesn't like because they are a different religion. "Reporting" should not be a tool for bullying.
I just want some minor changes, that cost FB nothing, to make things easier for the thousands of blind ppl who use FB.
Facebook.  That page you gave a link for does not work with screen readers ,  that the blind use.  i can't report, or suggest anything.
Isn't that just Typical Scott! :-(  2 word for you facebook: Disability FAIL.
